steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season chicken: Place chicken in baking dish; sprinkle with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning.
Bruschetta topping: In a bowl, mix diced tomatoes, garlic, basil, and optional balsamic. Spoon over chicken.
Bake: Cook ~15 minutes. If adding cheese, sprinkle on top and bake another ~5 minutes until chicken is cooked (165°F).

ingredientsNeeded: 1 lb chicken breasts (grilled or baked), sliced
1 head romaine lettuce (or bag of romaine)
steps: Cook chicken: Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder. Grill or bake until fully cooked. Slice into strips.
Assemble salad: Chop romaine, place in a large bowl.
Toss: Add dressing, Parmesan, and croutons. Toss.
Top with sliced chicken. Serve immediately.

ingredientsNeeded: 3–4 cups broccoli florets (blanched or lightly steamed)
1 can low-fat cream of mushroom or cream of chicken soup (or homemade white sauce)
½ cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mozzarella)
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook chicken: In a skillet, sauté cubed chicken with a bit of oil until lightly browned. Season.
Combine: In a baking dish, mix chicken, broccoli, soup, and half the cheese. Stir gently.
Top: Sprinkle remaining cheese and breadcrumbs on top.
Bake: ~25–30 minutes or until bubbly and chicken is fully cooked.

ingredientsNeeded: 1 lb chicken breasts or thighs, cut into chunks
steps: Layer ingredients: Place chicken, carrots, celery, onion in slow-cooker.
Season: Add thyme, bay leaf, salt, pepper.
Add broth: Enough to cover ~3/4 of ingredients.
Cook: On low for 6–8 hours (or high for ~4).
Serve: Remove bay leaf; adjust seasoning if needed.
Brown beef: In a skillet, cook beef, onion, pepper, mushrooms until beef is no longer pink. Drain excess fat.
Add sauce: Stir in tomato sauce, seasoning, salt, pepper. Simmer 5–10 minutes.
Top with cheese (optional) and let melt.
Serve with a side of whole grains or bread.

ingredientsNeeded: ½ lb ground beef (or lean beef)
steps: Cook spaghetti: According to package directions.
Brown beef: In a saucepan, sauté ground beef, onion, garlic until beef is browned. Drain if necessary.
Add tomatoes: Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper. Simmer ~10–15 minutes.
Combine: Toss with cooked spaghetti. Adjust seasoning.
Serve hot with Parmesan if desired.
